metadata.title: The Old Man and the Sea
metadata.author: Ernest Hemingway

text_structure.notes: Chapter breaks identified during kernel creation

structure_detection.notes: Continuous narrative without chapter divisions - treating as single unit

exposition.rationale: This section establishes Santiago as the protagonist, introducing his character as an aging fisherman who has gone 84 days without catching a fish. The opening pages establish the setting of a Cuban fishing village, Santiago's relationship with the boy Manolin, and his determination to break his unlucky streak by venturing far out to sea.

rising_action.rationale: The conflict intensifies as Santiago hooks the great marlin and begins his epic struggle at sea. This section develops the central tension between man and fish, showing Santiago's physical and mental endurance as he battles to land his prize while far from shore, creating mounting suspense about the outcome.

climax.rationale: The turning point occurs when Santiago finally kills the marlin after their prolonged battle, representing the peak of dramatic tension. This moment marks Santiago's greatest triumph as a fisherman, but also the beginning of his tragic loss as the dead marlin attracts sharks.

falling_action.rationale: The consequences of Santiago's victory unfold as sharks attack the marlin tied to his boat, systematically destroying his prize. Despite his desperate efforts to fight them off, Santiago loses most of the marlin to the sharks, transforming his triumph into apparent defeat during the journey home.

resolution.rationale: Santiago returns to shore with only the marlin's skeleton, physically exhausted but spiritually unbroken. The final pages show the aftermath of his journey, the boy's renewed devotion, and Santiago's dreams of lions, establishing the thematic conclusion about dignity in struggle and the nature of true victory.

voice.pov_description: Third person limited focused on Santiago's consciousness and memories
voice.focalization_description: Access limited to Santiago's internal experience and recollections

structure.plot_architecture_description: Single plot thread focused on Santiago's memory of the arm wrestling match

device_mediation.summary: Hemingway's understated prose style reinforces the narrative's focus on Santiago's dignity through sparse, precise language that mirrors the old fisherman's stoic character. The repetitive sentence structures and minimal figurative language create a meditative rhythm that aligns with the retrospective, memory-driven narrative structure.

micro_devices.name: Imagery

Reveals the stark contrast between Santiago's glorious past and diminished present
Establishes the theme of human dignity persisting despite physical decline
